sentence: Why do they call camels the ships of the desert? because theyre full of arab semen
explanation: refers to a type of vessel used for transport vs. a vessel used for transporting goods and people
first_new_sentence: The ship departed at dawn, carrying cargo across the sea.
second_new_sentence: The financial planner had a ship that he used to set sail for new investment opportunities.

sentence: What do you call an illegally parked frog? toad.
explanation: refers to a type of amphibian vs. toad as it relates to a term for an illegal parking situation
first_new_sentence: The toad jumped across the road, searching for a place to rest.

sentence: Why couldnt the octopus take off her bra? it had suction cups.
explanation: refers to the action of drawing in versus a device that draws in liquids or gases
first_new_sentence: The suction of the vacuum cleaner made it easy to clean the carpet.
second_new_sentence: The engineer designed a suction system to efficiently remove debris from the construction site.

sentence: Why do cows have bells? because their horns dont work
explanation: refers to an instrument that produces sound vs. a bony projection on an animals head
